Imagine you're holding a ball in your hand. Now, if you were to let go of it, the ball would fall to the ground. This is not because the ball wants to reach the ground, but because everything with mass, including the ball and the Earth, exerts an attractive force on every other mass in the universe. This force is proportional to the product of the masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

In simpler terms, when you let go of the ball, the Earth's mass pulls the ball towards it, causing it to fall.
